text: And all the respect in the world to the great Olympic gold medalist Wyomia Tyus, who in the face of sexism in the movement, still dedicated her 4X100 gold medal to John Carlos and Tommie Smith after they were exiled from the Olympic Village.
author: EdgeofSports

text: They absolutely changed the world. Consider the position of the Olympic athlete, the pro athlete, and the Black athlete before and after 1968. Within 20 years, floodgates of money opened up. The reasons for this are multifaceted but one, clearly, was fear of radical rebellion.
author: EdgeofSports
